sourcesContent:
import React from 'react' import { Helmet } from 'react-helmet' import BootstrapAlertsExample from './examples/alerts' import BootstrapBadgesExample from './examples/badges' import BootstrapFadeExample from './examples/fade' import BootstrapFormExample from './examples/form' import BootstrapTabsExample from './examples/tabs' import BootstrapToastsExample from './examples/toasts' import BootstrapTooltipsExample from './examples/tooltips' import BootstrapButtonDropdownExample from './examples/button-dropdown' import BootstrapBreadcrumbsExample from './examples/breadcrumbs' import BootstrapButtonGroupExample from './examples/button-group' import BootstrapButtonsExample from './examples/buttons' import BootstrapCardExample from './examples/card' import BootstrapCarouselExample from './examples/carousel' import BootstrapCollapseExample from './examples/collapse' import BootstrapDropdownsExample from './examples/dropdowns' import BootstrapInputGroupExample from './examples/input-group' import BootstrapJumbotronExample from './examples/jumbotron' import BootstrapTablesExample from './examples/tables' import BootstrapSpinnersExample from './examples/spinners' import BootstrapProgressExample from './examples/progress' import BootstrapPopoversExample from './examples/popovers' import BootstrapPaginationExample from './examples/pagination' import BootstrapNavExample from './examples/nav' import BootstrapNavbarExample from './examples/navbar' import BootstrapModalsExample from './examples/modals' import BootstrapMediaObjectExample from './examples/media-object' import BootstrapListGroupExample from './examples/listgroup' import BootstrapLayoutExample from './examples/layout' const examples = [ { name: 'Alerts', description: 'Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/alerts/', component: , }, { name: 'Badges / Pills', description: 'Documentation and examples for badges, our small count and labeling component.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/badge/', component: , }, { name: 'Breadcrumbs', description: 'Indicate the current page’s location within a navigational hierarchy that automatically adds separators via CSS.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/breadcrumbs/', component: , }, { name: 'Button Dropdown', description: 'Toggle contextual overlays for displaying lists of links and more with the Bootstrap dropdown plugin.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/button-dropdown/', component: , }, { name: 'Button Group', description: 'Group a series of buttons together on a single line with the button group, and super-power them with JavaScript.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/button-group/', component: , }, { name: 'Buttons', description: 'Use Bootstrap’s custom button styles for actions in forms, dialogs, and more with support for multiple sizes, states, and more.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/buttons/', component: , }, { name: 'Card', description: 'Bootstrap’s cards provide a flexible and extensible content container with multiple variants and options.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/card/', component: , }, { name: 'Carousel', description: 'A slideshow component for cycling through elements—images or slides of text—like a carousel.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/carousel/', component: , }, { name: 'Collapse', description: 'Toggle the visibility of content across your project with a few classes and our JavaScript plugins.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/collapse/', component: , }, { name: 'Dropdowns', description: 'Toggle contextual overlays for displaying lists of links and more with the Bootstrap dropdown plugin.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/dropdowns/', component: , }, { name: 'Fade', description: 'The content will fade in and out as the button is pressed.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/fade/', component: , }, { name: 'Form', description: 'Examples and usage guidelines for form control styles, layout options, and custom components for creating a wide variety of forms.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/form/', component: , }, { name: 'Input Group', description: 'Easily extend form controls by adding text, buttons, or button groups on either side of textual inputs, custom selects, and custom file inputs.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/input-group/', component: , }, { name: 'Jumbotron', description: 'Lightweight, flexible component for showcasing hero unit style content.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/jumbotron/', component: , }, { name: 'Layout', description: 'Components and options for laying out your Bootstrap project, including wrapping containers, a powerful grid system, a flexible media object, and responsive utility classes.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/layout/', component: , }, { name: 'ListGroup', description: 'List groups are a flexible and powerful component for displaying a series of content. Modify and extend them to support just about any content within.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/listgroup/', component: , }, { name: 'Media object', description: 'Documentation and examples for Bootstrap’s media object to construct highly repetitive components like blog comments, tweets, and the like.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/media/', component: , }, { name: 'Modals', description: 'Use Bootstrap’s JavaScript modal plugin to add dialogs to your site for lightboxes, user notifications, or completely custom content.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/modals/', component: , }, { name: 'Navbar', description: 'Documentation and examples for Bootstrap’s powerful, responsive navigation header, the navbar. Includes support for branding, navigation, and more, including support for our collapse plugin.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/navbar/', component: , }, { name: 'Navs', description: 'Documentation and examples for how to use Bootstrap’s included navigation components.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/navs/', component: , }, { name: 'Pagination', description: 'Documentation and examples for showing pagination to indicate a series of related content exists across multiple pages.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/pagination/', component: , }, { name: 'Popovers', description: 'Documentation and examples for adding Bootstrap popovers, like those found in iOS, to any element on your site.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/popovers/', component: , }, { name: 'Progress', description: 'Documentation and examples for using Bootstrap custom progress bars featuring support for stacked bars, animated backgrounds, and text labels.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/progress/', component: , }, { name: 'Spinners', description: 'Indicate the loading state of a component or page with Bootstrap spinners, built entirely with HTML, CSS, and no JavaScript.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/spinners/', component: , }, { name: 'Tables', description: 'Documentation and examples for opt-in styling of tables (given their prevalent use in JavaScript plugins) with Bootstrap.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/tables/', component: , }, { name: 'Tabs / Pills', description: "Documentation and examples for how to use Bootstrap's included tabs components.", link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/tabs/', component: , }, { name: 'Toasts', description: 'Push notifications to your visitors with a toast, a lightweight and easily customizable alert message.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/toasts/', component: , }, { name: 'Tooltips', description: 'Documentation and examples for adding custom Bootstrap tooltips with CSS and JavaScript using CSS3 for animations and data-attributes for local title storage.', link: 'https://reactstrap.github.io/components/tooltips/', component: , }, ] class UIKitBootstrap extends React.Component { state = { selectedExampleIndex: 0, } setExample = selectedExampleIndex => { this.setState({ selectedExampleIndex, }) } render() { const { selectedExampleIndex } = this.state const example = examples[selectedExampleIndex] return (
{/*
Bootstrap UI Kit Official Documentation
*/}
{examples.map((item, index) => ( ))}
{example.name} Component Docs & Examples Bootstrap Docs

{example.description}

{example.component}
) } } export default UIKitBootstrap
